name: Metropolia 2D Engine
body:
### Metropolia frameword for 2D game development.
The project is run by second year students from the Metropolia AMK in Espoo. The purpose is to learn software development and game development building a mini framework for 2D games.
The framework uses C# and .NET framework with OpenGL and TaoClassic.

###Purpose and Use
The main goal is to learn how to develop software. Nonetheless, if successful, the framework may be used for further purposes like thesis topic or commercial release.

###Stages
At the time of writing (09/11/2013) the framework has just begun and only include the basics of the application and some parts of the math engine. 

### Authors and Contributors
The participants are second year students of the Finnish IT program of the Metropolia AMK in Espoo, Finland.

Those are:

Alasalmi Mika, Alhokankare Annika, Bergström Rasmus,Derghokasian Andre, Halonen Antti, Hiltunen Mika, Hyytiäinen Erkki, Ikonen Eetu, Karhu Tuomo, Kiiskinen Kasper, Kuisma Sami,Kuusela Jonne,Lindell Mikko, Lipiäinen Anatoli, Nasri Kami, Niittukari Arto, Parkkulainen Erkki,Pellosniemi Janne, Pikarla, Olli,Pöllänen Teemu,Ristimäki Samuli,Sherko Ahmed, Siitonen Panu, Sinokki Henri, Sundqvist Kimmo,Vainio Topias, Verainen Jesse.

The group is supervised by Cosson Lucas.

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with Pages? Check out the documentation at http://help.github.com/pages or contact support@github.com and we’ll help you sort it out.
